intro: Malvastrum nesioticum subsp. nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's mallow, is a flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are palmately lobed with a fuzzy texture. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. The species is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in rocky soils and disturbed areas.
